item.title: HugoBook+GithubAction
item.description: In Windows10, build personal website via Hugo-book and Github Actions # This blog is about how to use Hugo to create the local website, and then deploy it on GitHub via Github Action. Everything is step by step. Prerequisites # Git Windows 10 VScode Github account Install Hugo # In Windows10, right click Windows Powershell and click run as administrator. Refer to How to install chocolatey in Windows to install chocolatey.

item.title: TP Binder Design
item.description: Binder Design # In this blog, I want to make notes on how I design the binder of the target protein using RFdiffusion, ProteinMPNN-FastRelax and so on. AF-A2VEY9-F1, Alphafold. In this case, I take the A2VEY9 as the example. Its 3D view is here Step0: Labaries and Helpful tools # from biopandas.pdb import PandasPdb from itertools import chain from Bio import PDB import numpy as np import pandas as pd import plotly.

item.title: 4 levels of protein structure
item.description: There are four levels of protein structure: primary, secondary, tertiary and quaternary. Primary Structure. # A protein’s primary structure is the unique sequence of amino acids in each polypeptide chain that makes up the protein. fasta file sequence of 20 amino acids Secondary Structure # Reference: # 3.9: Proteins - Protein Structure Thanks! # Really appreciate your time for reading my blog, and bless you enjoy your day! If you have any suggestions or comments, please leave them below!

item.title: Hugo Commands
item.description: How to insert images and resize and center images? # The file tree is like ├─content │ │ _index.md │ │ │ └─docs │ ├─blogs │ │ │ hugo.md │ │ │ _index.md │ │ │ │ │ └─images │ │ Nice.png In hugo.md file, we add Nice.png and scale it by {{< figure src="../images/Nice.png" width="400" alt=" " >}} Why we need to add ../ in front of images folder, altough hugo.

item.title: Shell Commands
item.description: Shell Commands # How to discard changes in VScode? # Navigate to reporsitory (has .github folder) with changes. Then, git restore <file>
